intro: Cnestis urens, commonly known as the bladder nut or yellow bladder, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow, capsule-like fruits that resemble small bladders. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and palmate leaves. Its flowers are small and usually pale yellow, arranged in clusters. Cnestis urens is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and waste areas.
